GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/topics.description: serves an array of all topics

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: serves selected article by its id, and respond include total comment count of the selected article

articles.title: Living in the shadow of a great man
articles.author: butter_bridge

description: Serves an array of all articles, default sorted by date in descending order, accepting queries below:

description.topic: will respond with the articles by the topic value specified in the query.
description.sort_by: will respond with the articles sort by any valid column from articles.
description.limit: pagination: which limits the number of responses (defaults to 10)
description.p: pagination: page, specifies the page at which to start (calculated using limit)

articles.title: Living in the shadow of a great man
articles.author: butter_bridge

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: responds with an array of comments objects from selected article by article ID. Comments served with the most recent comments first.

comments.author: butter_bridge
comments.body: Oh, I've got compassion running out of my nose, pal! I'm the Sultan of Sentiment!

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: add a comment for an article (seleted by article ID), accept properties: username and body. Will responds with the posted comment.

exampleRequest.body: Isn't that sweet, i guess so

postedComment.author: rogersop
postedComment.body: Isn't that sweet, i guess so

PATCH /api/articles/:article_id.description: update an article by article_id, accept properties: newVotes (in the form of key pair values, ex: { inc_votes : 1 }, which increase the selected article's vote by 1), and responds with the updated article.

updatedArticle.title: Living in the shadow of a great man
updatedArticle.author: butter_bridge

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: delete the given comment by comment_id

GET /api/users.description: responds with all users, which are an array of objects with: username, name, avatar_url

GET /api/users/:username.description: responds user by username with an array of users objects with username, name, avatar_url

PATCH /api/comments/:comment_id.description: update an comment by comment_id, accept properties: newVotes (in the form of key pair values, ex: { inc_votes : 1 }, which increase the selected comment's vote by 1), and responds with the updated comment.
